metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0246 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
SOSreport stores the md5 hash of the GRUB bootloader password in an archive, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information by reading the archive.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0246` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

sosreport - 3.4-1~ubuntu14.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> Fixed upstream in the 3.2 release

criterions.comment: sosreport package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4-1~ubuntu14.04.1').
